author: A_Brickset_user
title: Useful
review: The set on its own isn't too good, but is great for any town collector, if only for the hydrant and street lamps. The gate piece is very fragile and falls over easily. The cop car isn't up to much but the tan car is nice. The thug is nice and young spidey has a very good head.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Nice City Accessories
review: Had to pick up one of these for my train town at LSAH price of $10.  I would recommend this set at $10 for the city accessories.  I love the hydrant, two trash cans (with lids), the lamp post, and the street sign with lamp. Unfortunately, stickers are required for the street signs.  The cars are excellent except for the lack of doors and very low clearing between the car bottom and ground. I really like the spiderman vehicles (except for the lack of doors). The gate is ok and if placed on another plate (like a road plate), works well.  The set should really be worth $10 and at this price, I think its worth it. Offers playability on its own or with your city.

author: ratz
title: city accessories!
review:
i finally opened my copy of this set, and i'm pleased to find a lot of useful parts and ideas for a lego town: not only 2 individual, fully equipped cars, but also a gate, a trashcan, lamps, street signs etc. the criminal is surprisingly well dressed, spiderman has a nice torso, so there's nothing to complain about the minifigs. 
the only thing i don't understand is the gate mechanism, trying to provide playability, but failing in this regard. well, that doesn't bother me, i strongly advise to get this set.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Awsome city builder
review:
The Spider-Man's first chase set (4850) is a LEGO Spider-Man set which came out in 2003. It's part of the first Spider-Man movie and contains 2 vehicles, a gate and some accessories for your LEGO city you're building. This set includes some stickers and 191 pieces.

Minifigures:

  • Car thief: The car thief comes with an orange shirt and a grey jacket. He comes with a grey hat and green pants. He also got the face of one race drivers from the LEGO Race theme.
  • Cop: The cop comes with the basic LEGO World City police uniform, black pants and a black cap. He also got a smiley face.
  • Spidey: Spidey has a double-printed torso and a red mask. He also comes with blue pants. This suit is the first suit which Spider-Man is wearing.
Cars:

  • Police Car: The police car has very cool lights on the ceilling which can be taken off easily. This vehicle has some nice lights on the front and on the back. You even get a little grill on the front.
  • Uncle Ben's Car: Uncle Ben's car is easy to build aswell. The ceilling can be taken off and on the front and on the back. The front even shows you a Volvo sign.
Accessories & Gate:

  • Gate: The gate is really cool. You get a lamp and a "keep out" signon the top. You get a lever to lock the gate doors where uncle Ben's car is supposed to smash through.
  • Accessories: You get fantastic accessories for your LEGO city in this set: It comes with another lamp which has some street signs. There's a garbage can, a black cat and a fire hydrant.
Positive:

  • Cars are very cool
  • Nice looking gate
  • Accessories for your LEGO city
  • Minifigures
  • Ideas
Negative:

  • Stickers
All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can only find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

Videos I made of this set:

author: MIDAS
title: A really great spider-man set!
review:
Introduction

This was always one of my favourite spider-man set, and it's a shame that it's since moved on to build other things really! I got it from a friend who went to legoland in about 2004, so i can't really complain about the price at all - though it's about right I think.

Minfigs

The minifigs are all pretty cool, though i find the world city cop seems unseasonably happy for what is happening in the scene. Spider-man looks cool, it's his early outfit and it represents it fairly well. The criminal is okay, though he looks very different in the film, his outfit looks cool enough.

Main set

I do like the two cars, they're greatly detailed and it's weird that they didn't adopt this style of car building for city sets. The gate is a little clumsy, but still quite cool, and the extra bits such as the fire hydrant, street signs and cat are all great additions. It also has what i guess is the radioactive spider that started it all in trans red.

Overall

It is a great set worth looking for online if you really want it, but i'd say a better idea would be to print of some instructions and try and build the cars with pieces from other sets, maybe in other colours for variation! You'll probably find this for between £30 and £60 online, which is a bit much for what you get, but it's a classic that's worth tracking down! 

Pros and Cons

For the people without much time, like me, pros and cons;

  • Quite a good looking set overall.
  • Nice cars and good minifigs.
  • A classic set!
  • Cat and spider both good for cities.
  • Same with fire hydrant and lamposts.
  • Gate looks cool!
  • Represents the scene well!
